definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
to feel/to sense/to have the feeling that/to think that/to move/to affect
to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
emotion/sentiment/affection/feelings between two persons/CL:個|个[ge4],種|种[zhong3]
to feel/to sense/to detect/to perceive/to become aware
to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved

sentences.english: Eric Suen Yiu Wai and Chan Fa La felt embarrassed when they were playing heartbeat measurement.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威和陈法拉玩量度心跳，都感尴尬。

sentences.english: Two golden curves across the card surface add an artistic touch to the design.
sentences.chinese: 另外卡面设计以两道金色弧线为主题，极富艺术感。

sentences.english: Mrs. Archer and her group felt a certain timidity concerning these persons.
sentences.chinese: 对这班人阿切尔夫人和她那个小圈子怀有某种畏怯感。

sentences.english: Her Louboutin ankle boots provide that high-fashion edge she's become famous for.
sentences.chinese: 她的鲁布托过膝靴提供了她著名的高级时尚感。

sentences.english: Acupuncture may cause just a little pain, but it also causes a certain feeling of numbness and distension.
sentences.chinese: 针刺只有轻微疼痛，它产生一定的麻和胀感。

sentences.english: The"Madding Crowd"conceals the deep sense of illusion and absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 热闹喧嚣的场面下，蕴涵着浓重的虚幻感和荒诞意识。

sentences.english: The effect of real-time water surface can consumedly enhance the immersion characteristic of virtual reality system.
sentences.chinese: 实时水面效果可以大大增强虚拟现实系统的沉浸感。

sentences.english: Large cysts can cause backaches and a dragging sensation.
sentences.chinese: 体积较大的囊肿可引起背痛及牵扯感。

sentences.english: Thus, traditional JDC model should consider self-efficacy variable.
sentences.chinese: 因此，传统的JDC模型应充分考虑个体自我效能感。

sentences.english: Try to pay attention as you eat and stop when you're full.
sentences.chinese: 请尽量注意你的饱足感，如果你觉得饱了就不要再吃。

sentences.english: the pervading emotion is, I'd say, just stress and hurriedness.
sentences.chinese: 这里的人们最普遍的感受还是压力以及慌忙感。

sentences.english: I think the voice urging Liu Haisu autumn, there is a sense of urgency.
sentences.chinese: 想是秋声催栗感，不教怀旧转怀新。

sentences.english: Only silent prayer, I should not have a sense of destiny, but how could I resist?
sentences.chinese: 只有默祷，我没有命运感，但我怎么能抗拒？

sentences.english: In empty-shell marriages the spouses feel no strong attachment to each other.
sentences.chinese: 空壳婚姻地配头两边之间没很强地眷恋感。

sentences.english: The water is oily to the touch.
Why did she have the kind of unspeakable loneliness?
sentences.chinese: 为什么她会有那种说不出的孤寂感？

definition: to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
the feeling that sth is genuine/sense of reality/in the flesh
to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
ample/complete/hundred percent/a pure shade (of some color)
that/that kind of/that sort of/that type of
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)

to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
style (of art or literature)/form/one's work style/moral character
